alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:31AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDuffie, Columbia, southeastern Lincoln, northwestern Richmond, Edgefield, northwestern Aiken and southeastern McCormick Counties through 1100 AM EDT... At 1031 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Evans, moving northeast at 35 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Martinez, Fort Gordon, Edgefield, Harlem, Appling, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, Riverwood, Mistletoe State Park, Hamilton Branch State Park, Village Plaza Shopping Center, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Augusta Mall, Trenton, Parksville, Plum Branch and Poverty Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 176 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
